verses.roman:
kim etat sūkara-vyājaṁ
sattvaṁ divyam avasthitam
aho batāścaryam idaṁ
nāsāyā me viniḥsṛtam

synonyms: kim—what; etat—this; sūkara—boar; vyājam—pretension; sattvam—entity; divyam—extraordinary; avasthitam—situated; aho bata—oh, it is; āścaryam—very wonderful; idam—this; nāsāyāḥ—from the nose; me—my; viniḥsṛtam—came out.
translation: Is this some extraordinary entity come in the pretense of a boar? It is very wonderful that He has come from my nose.
